question: Have 5q35 microdeletions been implicated in Sotos syndrome development?
ideal_answer: Loss-of-function mutations of NSD1 and 5q35 microdeletions encompassing NSD1 are a major cause of Sotos syndrome (Sos), which is characterized by overgrowth, macrocephaly, characteristic facies, and variable intellectual disability (ID).
